title: Dynamic Component Description
description: A full description of a dynamic component in the AICA application framework.

name.title: Component Name
name.description: The human-readable name of the component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: The human-readable description of this component and its behaviour.

brief.description: A brief (one-line) description of the component for quick reference and tool-tips.
examples: Generates a velocity command towards a target attractor

details.description: An optional detailed description of the component.
examples: Given an input Cartesian pose and parameterized target pose, this component generates a Cartesian twist output towards the target linearly proportional to the distance multiplied by the gain parameter.

virtual.title: Virtual Component Class
virtual.description: If true, this property indicates that the component is an abstract or virtual base class and not directly instantiable.

inputs.title: Component Input Signals
inputs.description: The fixed input signals (subscriptions) of the component.

items.title: Signal
items.description: A continuous data signal in the AICA framework that can be an input or an output.

display_name.description: The short name of this signal (to be displayed on the edge of the node in the graph view).

description.description: A description of the signal for tool-tips and documentation.

signal_name.description: The registered name of the signal from which the default topic and parameter '<$signal_name>_topic' are determined.

default_topic.description: The default topic name assigned to this signal. If unspecified, it is assumed to be '~/<$signal_name>'. Setting the parameter '<$signal_name>_topic' will override the default value.

reconfigurable_topic.description: Indicate if the signal topic is reconfigurable and can be renamed while the parent node is inactive through the '<$signal_name>_topic' parameter.

signal_type.description: The fixed type of this signal.

signal_types.description: An array of signal types supported by configurable typing. The active type is set through the '<$signal_name>_type' parameter, and the default type is determined by the `signal_type` property.

items.title: Signal Type
items.description: Supported signal value types as simple atomic types or encoded state types.

anyOf.title: Encoded State Type
anyOf.description: The state type of an encoded value from a collection of supported types, as defined in clproto.

reconfigurable_type.description: Indicate if the signal type is reconfigurable and can be renamed while the parent node is inactive through the '<$signal_name>_type' parameter.

custom_signal_type.description: The custom signal type of the signal

input_collections.title: Component Input Signal Collections
input_collections.description: The dynamically assignable input signals (subscriptions) of the component.

items.title: Input Signal Collection
items.description: A dynamic collection of input signals that can have zero or more topics of the same type.

display_name.description: The short name of this input signal collection (to be displayed on the edge of the component).

description.description: A description of the signal collection for tool-tips and documentation.

input_collection_name.description: The registered name of the input collection from which the parameter '<$input_collection_name>_topics' is determined.

default_topics.description: The optional default array of topic names in this signal collection. Setting the parameter '<$input_collection_name>_topics' will override the default value.

reconfigurable_topics.description: Indicate if the array of input collection topics is reconfigurable and can be changed while the component is inactive through the '<$input_collection_name>_topics' parameter.

signal_type.description: The default type of the signals (signals in a collection must have the same type).

signal_types.description: An array of signal types supported by configurable typing. The active type is set through the '<$input_collection_name>_type' parameter, and the default type is determined by the `signal_type` property.

reconfigurable_type.description: Indicate if the signal type is reconfigurable and can be changed while the component is inactive through the '<$input_collection_name>_type' parameter.

outputs.title: Component Output Signals
outputs.description: The output signals (publications) of the component.

parameters.title: Component Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters declared by the component.

items.title: Parameter
items.description: A dynamic parameter that is publicly configurable.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter.

parameter_name.description: The lower_snake_case parameter name as it is declared in the implementation.

parameter_state_type.description: The state type of the parameter, if the value type is an encoded state.

default_value.description: The string representation of the default parameter value, or null if the parameter has no valid default value.

optional.description: Specify if this parameter is optional (only applicable if the default value is null)

dynamic.description: Specify if this parameter can be dynamically reconfigured.

internal.description: Specify if this parameter is for internal use only and should be hidden from public users.

predicates.title: Component Predicates
predicates.description: The predicates provided by the component.

items.title: Component Predicate
items.description: A predicate signal parameter of a dynamic component.

description.description: A brief description of the predicate.

predicate_name.description: The lower_snake_case predicate name as it is declared in the component.

services.title: Component Services
services.description: The services provided by the component.

items.title: Component Service
items.description: A service endpoint of a dynamic component.

description.description: A brief description of the service.

service_name.description: The lower_snake_case service name as it is declared in the component.

payload_format.description: Optional description of the payload format if the service has a string payload. If omitted, the service is assumed to be an empty trigger.

registration.title: Component Registration
registration.description: The full registered class name of the exported component required for run-time loading. The registration must start with the package name and may include additional namespaces delimited by double colons `::`.
